answers.answer: Do you have gestational diabetes?  If you don't know, ask your doc for a glucose test.
Hey...noticed you screen name...is your name Miranda, Mine is!  :)

I measured big with both of my girls and then later on it evened out.  I think it can be very normal to "measure" farther along than you are.  Are you talking about when they tape measure your belly?  Or are you talking about an ultrasound?  Either way - I think it can be off.

Miranda nice,All these post & never new your name.My name is Adriana.How have you been?Is Af still here?Haven't gotten mine.Your closer to ttc than me,yay,Well when time comes I'll be crossing everything for you till then.Quick ?.I posted on another thread (yahoo)pregnancy after ectopic.& they adviced me that b/f I ttc to get an hsg to check if my tubes are clear?Did your dr. tell you this?I assumed that with metho. their would be nothing left?Sorry to take up space just been wanting to ask you.***nanis

So many things can affect how you measure when it comes to doing the fundal height. Maternal body style, baby's position, or sometimes they happen to catch the baby in a growth spurt.BTW, a heart rate can't tell you how old a baby is, so I wouldn't worry about that part.Andi
I went for my monthly appt yesterday and they said I was measuring 18 weeks and I am only 17.  I am only a week off but still it should right itself later on.
Twins would show up I think with 2 heartbeats and also would show up in the u/s. Did dr say it could be twins?

question: I went to the doctor yesterday and according to my LMP I should be around 15-16 weeks. When my doctor measured me, I measured 20 weeks but he said the baby's heart beat measured 15-16 weeks. I had an ultrasound really early at 6 weeks to confirm my date. Should I be concerned there is a problem, or that it could be twins?
title: Uterus large for date
